cards.title: Surfing / Surfers take on giant waves off coast of Kalbarri
cards.rawTitle: Surfers take on giant waves off coast of Kalbarri

item.title: Surfers take on giant waves off coast of Kalbarri, Australia
item.trailText: Film-maker Christopher Lewis captures daredevil surfers taking on huge waves off the coast of Western Australia
item.standFirst:
Film-maker Christopher Lewis captures daredevil surfers taking on huge waves off the coast of Western Australia. Some waves reached 18 metres high and were caused by low-pressure systems over the Indian Ocean. Watch the video in full on Christopher's Vimeo channel

Click to see a photo gallery of the surfers in action

cards.title: Rugby union / South Africa will use Rugby Championship as World Cup test
cards.rawTitle: South Africa will use Rugby Championship as World Cup test

item.title: South Africa will use Championship as World Cup test
item.trailText: Meyer: South Africa will use Championship as World Cup test - video
item.standFirst: The Springboks train on Monday in Johannesburg ahead of their World XV in Cape Town on 11 July before flying to Australia to start the Rugby Championship. The team are looking at a tight schedule of competitive matches and warm-ups before their first game against Japan on 19 September

cards.title: Women's World Cup / England ready for their semi-final against Japan – Sampson
cards.rawTitle: England ready for their semi-final against Japan – Sampson

item.title: England ready for Women's World Cup semi-final against Japan
item.trailText: Mark Sampson, the England manager, and Jodi Taylor, an England striker, reflect on the team's victory over hosts Canada
item.standFirst: Mark Sampson, the England manager, and Jodi Taylor, an England striker, reflect on the team's victory over hosts Canada in the quarter-final of the Women's World Cup in Vancouver and look ahead to the semi-final match on Wednesday. Sampson says he is proud of the team for their performance on Sunday. Taylor says she is looking forward to the next match against Japan

cards.title: Tennis / Djokovic defends communicating with Becker during matches
cards.rawTitle: Djokovic defends communicating with Becker during matches

item.title: Djokovic defends communicating with Becker during matches
item.trailText: Speaking on Sunday, the world tennis number one, Novak Djokovic, rebuts allegations of cheating during matches by communicating with trainer Boris Becker
item.standFirst: Speaking on Sunday, the world tennis number one, Novak Djokovic, rebuts allegations of cheating during matches by communicating with trainer Boris Becker. Djokovic says there is nothing unusual about the way he and Becker communicate during matches, adding that it would be obvious if Becker was telling him how to play. Djokovic plays Philipp Kohlschreiber in his first match at Wimbledon on Monday

displayImages.credit: Maddie Meyer - FIFA/FIFA via Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Australia’s Lydia Williams and Emily Van Egmond claim for offside after Mana Iwabuchi fired home an 87th minute winner following a pass from Azusa Iwashimizu. Williams, the Matilda’s keeper, had bravely saved at the feet of Iwashimizu, but the defender recovered and slipped the ball to her team-mate at the far post, who can be seen in the background celebrating

cards.title: Cricket / Several Ashes spots are still up for grabs, says Australia's Lehmann
cards.rawTitle: Several Ashes spots are still up for grabs, says Australia's Lehmann

item.title: Australia's Ashes team: several spots still up for grabs, says Lehmann
item.trailText: Australian cricket coach Darren Lehmann speaks to the media after his team took a comfortable victory over Kent
item.standFirst: Australian cricket coach Darren Lehmann speaks to the media after his team took a comfortable victory over Kent. Australia won their opening tour match by 255 runs in Canterbury today. The team now travels to Colchester for their second tour match against Essex, before the first Ashes Test next week. When asked to share who's in the first Test, Lehmann jokes 'Clarke, Smith'

cards.title: In pictures / Surfers in Australia tackle once-in-a-decade waves
cards.rawTitle: Surfers in Australia tackle once-in-a-decade waves

item.title: Monster swell: surfers in Australia tackle once-in-a-decade waves
item.trailText: Daredevils off the coast of Western Australia have been braving waves as tall as 18 metres. We sent the celebrated surfing photographer Russell Ord into the mix to document the infamous break known as ‘The Right’
item.standFirst:
Daredevils in Western Australia have been braving waves as tall as 18 metres – more than five storeys – as a swell caused by a low-pressure system over the Indian Ocean swept the coast. One surfer broke his leg in Margaret River as he came crashing down ‘probably the biggest wave ever ridden in Australia’ and got pummelled by 15 metres of whitewater. We sent the celebrated surfing photographer Russell Ord into the mix to document the infamous break known as ‘The Right’

Click to watch video of the surfers in action
